bibl.title: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, January 22, 1916

div1.p: Stimpson sends Carter a copy of a letter to St. Vincent's hospital regarding payment for Carter's treatment there.

div1.head: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, January 22, 1916
div1.opener:
PM
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 22, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of January 14th, you
are informed that the inclosed copy of letter has
been written to the Superintendent, St. Vincent's
Hospital, Birmingham, Ala., asking that a voucher
be rendered for cost of treatment furnished yourself
while under treatment at that hospital.

In regard to treatment furnished you in hospital
at San Juan, you are informed that voucher therefor
should be rendered in favor of the hospital, on form
1949.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, W. G. Stimpson
Assistant Surgeon General. Incl: 1.
